entry.title: sindresorhus/eslint-plugin-unicorn
entry.summary:
More than 100 powerful ESLint rules

eslint-plugin-unicorn

More than 100 powerful ESLint rules

You might want to check out XO, which includes this plugin.

Propose or contribute a new rule âž¡

Install

npm install --save-dev eslint eslint-plugin-unicorn

Usage (eslint.config.js)

Requires ESLint >=8.56.0.

Use a preset config or configure each rule in eslint.config.js.

If you don't use the preset, ensure you use the same languageOptions config as below.

ES Module (Recommended)

import eslintPluginUnicorn from 'eslint-plugin-unicorn';
import globals from 'globals';

export default [
	{
		languageOptions: {
			globals: globals.builtin,
		},
		plugins: {
			unicorn: eslintPluginUnicorn,
		},
		rules: {
			'unicorn/better-regex': 'error',
			'unicorn/â€¦': 'error',
		},
	},
	// â€¦
];

CommonJS

'use strict';
const eslintPluginUnicorn = require('eslint-plugin-unicorn');
const globals = require('globals');

module.exports = [
	{
		languageOptions: {
			globals: globals.builtin,
		},
		plugins: {
			unicorn: eslintPluginUnicorn,
		},
		rules: {
			'unicorn/better-regex': 'error',
			'unicorn/â€¦': 'error',
		},
	},
	// â€¦
];

Usage (legacy: .eslintrc.* or package.json)

Use a preset config or configure each rule in package.json.

If you don't use the preset, ensure you use the same env and parserOptions config as below.

{
	"name": "my-awesome-project",
	"eslintConfig": {
		"env": {
			"es2024": true
		},
		"parserOptions": {
			"ecmaVersion": "latest",
			"sourceType": "module"
		},
		"plugins": [
			"unicorn"
		],
		"rules": {
			"unicorn/better-regex": "error",
			"unicorn/â€¦": "error"
		}
	}
}

Rules

ðŸ’¼ Configurations enabled in.
âœ… Set in the recommended configuration.
ðŸ”§ Automatically fixable by the --fix CLI option.
ðŸ’¡ Manually fixable by editor suggestions.

Name                                    Description ðŸ’¼ ðŸ”§ ðŸ’¡
better-regex Improve regexes by making them shorter, consistent, and safer. ðŸ”§
catch-error-name Enforce a specific parameter name in catch clauses. âœ… ðŸ”§
consistent-destructuring Use destructured variables over properties. ðŸ”§ ðŸ’¡
consistent-empty-array-spread Prefer consistent types when spreading a ternary in an array literal. âœ… ðŸ”§
consistent-existence-index-check Enforce consistent style for element existence checks with indexOf(), lastIndexOf(), findIndex(), and findLastIndex(). âœ… ðŸ”§
consistent-function-scoping Move function definitions to the highest possible scope. âœ…
custom-error-definition Enforce correct Error subclassing. ðŸ”§
empty-brace-spaces Enforce no spaces between braces. âœ… ðŸ”§
error-message Enforce passing a message value when creating a built-in error. âœ…
escape-case Require escape sequences to use uppercase values. âœ… ðŸ”§
expiring-todo-comments Add expiration conditions to TODO comments. âœ…
explicit-length-check Enforce explicitly comparing the length or size property of a value. âœ… ðŸ”§ ðŸ’¡
filename-case Enforce a case style for filenames. âœ…
import-style Enforce specific import styles per module. âœ…
new-for-builtins Enforce the use of new for all builtins, except String, Number, Boolean, Symbol and BigInt. âœ… ðŸ”§
no-abusive-eslint-disable Enforce specifying rules to disable in eslint-disable comments. âœ…
no-anonymous-default-export Disallow anonymous functions and classes as the default export. âœ… ðŸ’¡
no-array-callback-reference Prevent passing a function reference directly to iterator methods. âœ… ðŸ’¡
no-array-for-each Prefer forâ€¦of over the forEach method. âœ… ðŸ”§ ðŸ’¡
no-array-method-this-argument Disallow using the this argument in array methods. âœ… ðŸ”§ ðŸ’¡
no-array-push-push Enforce combining multiple Array#push() into one call. âœ… ðŸ”§ ðŸ’¡
no-array-reduce Disallow Array#reduce() and Array#reduceRight(). âœ…
no-await-expression-member Disallow member access from await expression. âœ… ðŸ”§
no-await-in-promise-methods Disallow using await in Promise method parameters. âœ… ðŸ’¡
no-console-spaces Do not use leading/trailing space between console.log parameters. âœ… ðŸ”§
no-document-cookie Do not use document.cookie directly. âœ…
no-empty-file Disallow empty files. âœ…
no-for-loop Do not use a for loop that can be replaced with a for-of loop. âœ… ðŸ”§ ðŸ’¡
no-hex-escape Enforce the use of Unicode escapes instead of hexadecimal escapes. âœ… ðŸ”§
no-instanceof-array Require Array.isArray() instead of instanceof Array. âœ… ðŸ”§
no-invalid-fetch-options Disallow invalid options in fetch() and new Request(). âœ…
no-invalid-remove-event-listener Prevent calling EventTarget#removeEventListener() with the result of an expression. âœ…
no-keyword-prefix Disallow identifiers starting with new or class.
no-length-as-slice-end Disallow using .length as the end argument of {Array,String,TypedArray}#slice(). âœ… ðŸ”§
no-lonely-if Disallow if statements as the only statement in if blocks without else. âœ… ðŸ”§
no-magic-array-flat-depth Disallow a magic number as the depth argument in Array#flat(â€¦). âœ…
no-negated-condition Disallow negated conditions. âœ… ðŸ”§
no-negation-in-equality-check Disallow negated expression in equality check. âœ… ðŸ’¡
no-nested-ternary Disallow nested ternary expressions. âœ… ðŸ”§
no-new-array Disallow new Array(). âœ… ðŸ”§ ðŸ’¡
no-new-buffer Enforce the use of Buffer.from() and Buffer.alloc() instead of the deprecated new Buffer(). âœ… ðŸ”§ ðŸ’¡
no-null Disallow the use of the null literal. âœ… ðŸ”§ ðŸ’¡
no-object-as-default-parameter Disallow the use of objects as default parameters. âœ…
no-process-exit Disallow process.exit(). âœ…
no-single-promise-in-promise-methods Disallow passing single-element arrays to Promise methods. âœ… ðŸ”§ ðŸ’¡
no-static-only-class Disallow classes that only have static members. âœ… ðŸ”§
no-thenable Disallow then property. âœ…
no-this-assignment Disallow assigning this to a variable. âœ…
no-typeof-undefined Disallow comparing undefined using typeof. âœ… ðŸ”§ ðŸ’¡
no-unnecessary-await Disallow awaiting non-promise values. âœ… ðŸ”§
no-unnecessary-polyfills Enforce the use of built-in methods instead of unnecessary polyfills. âœ…
no-unreadable-array-destructuring Disallow unreadable array destructuring. âœ… ðŸ”§
no-unreadable-iife Disallow unreadable IIFEs. âœ…
no-unused-properties Disallow unused object properties.
no-useless-fallback-in-spread Disallow useless fallback when spreading in object literals. âœ… ðŸ”§
no-useless-length-check Disallow useless array length check. âœ… ðŸ”§
no-useless-promise-resolve-reject Disallow returning/yielding Promise.resolve/reject() in async functions or promise callbacks âœ… ðŸ”§
no-useless-spread Disallow unnecessary spread. âœ… ðŸ”§
no-useless-switch-case Disallow useless case in switch statements. âœ… ðŸ’¡
no-useless-undefined Disallow useless undefined. âœ… ðŸ”§
no-zero-fractions Disallow number literals with zero fractions or dangling dots. âœ… ðŸ”§
number-literal-case Enforce proper case for numeric literals. âœ… ðŸ”§
numeric-separators-style Enforce the style of numeric separators by correctly grouping digits. âœ… ðŸ”§
prefer-add-event-listener Prefer .addEventListener() and .removeEventListener() over on-functions. âœ… ðŸ”§
prefer-array-find Prefer .find(â€¦) and .findLast(â€¦) over the first or last element from .filter(â€¦). âœ… ðŸ”§ ðŸ’¡
prefer-array-flat Prefer Array#flat() over legacy techniques to flatten arrays. âœ… ðŸ”§
prefer-array-flat-map Prefer .flatMap(â€¦) over .map(â€¦).flat(). âœ… ðŸ”§
prefer-array-index-of Prefer Array#{indexOf,lastIndexOf}() over Array#{findIndex,findLastIndex}() when looking for the index of an item. âœ… ðŸ”§ ðŸ’¡
prefer-array-some Prefer .some(â€¦) over .filter(â€¦).length check and .{find,findLast,findIndex,findLastIndex}(â€¦). âœ… ðŸ”§ ðŸ’¡
prefer-at Prefer .at() method for index access and String#charAt(). âœ… ðŸ”§ ðŸ’¡
prefer-blob-reading-methods Prefer Blob#arrayBuffer() over FileReader#readAsArrayBuffer(â€¦) and Blob#text() over FileReader#readAsText(â€¦). âœ…
prefer-code-point Prefer String#codePointAt(â€¦) over String#charCodeAt(â€¦) and String.fromCodePoint(â€¦) over String.fromCharCode(â€¦). âœ… ðŸ’¡
prefer-date-now Prefer Date.now() to get the number of milliseconds since the Unix Epoch. âœ… ðŸ”§
prefer-default-parameters Prefer default parameters over reassignment. âœ… ðŸ”§ ðŸ’¡
prefer-dom-node-append Prefer Node#append() over Node#appendChild(). âœ… ðŸ”§
prefer-dom-node-dataset Prefer using .dataset on DOM elements over calling attribute methods. âœ… ðŸ”§
prefer-dom-node-remove Prefer childNode.remove() over parentNode.removeChild(childNode). âœ… ðŸ”§ ðŸ’¡
prefer-dom-node-text-content Prefer .textContent over .innerText. âœ… ðŸ’¡
prefer-event-target Prefer EventTarget over EventEmitter. âœ…
prefer-export-from Prefer exportâ€¦from when re-exporting. âœ… ðŸ”§ ðŸ’¡
prefer-global-this Prefer globalThis over window, self, and global. âœ… ðŸ”§
prefer-includes Prefer .includes() over .indexOf(), .lastIndexOf(), and Array#some() when checking for existence or non-existence. âœ… ðŸ”§ ðŸ’¡
prefer-json-parse-buffer Prefer reading a JSON file as a buffer. ðŸ”§
prefer-keyboard-event-key Prefer KeyboardEvent#key over KeyboardEvent#keyCode. âœ… ðŸ”§
prefer-logical-operator-over-ternary Prefer using a logical operator over a ternary. âœ… ðŸ’¡
prefer-math-min-max Prefer Math.min() and Math.max() over ternaries for simple comparisons. âœ… ðŸ”§
prefer-math-trunc Enforce the use of Math.trunc instead of bitwise operators. âœ… ðŸ”§ ðŸ’¡
prefer-modern-dom-apis Prefer .before() over .insertBefore(), .replaceWith() over .replaceChild(), prefer one of .before(), .after(), .append() or .prepend() over insertAdjacentText() and insertAdjacentElement(). âœ… ðŸ”§
prefer-modern-math-apis Prefer modern Math APIs over legacy patterns. âœ… ðŸ”§
prefer-module Prefer JavaScript modules (ESM) over CommonJS. âœ… ðŸ”§ ðŸ’¡
prefer-native-coercion-functions Prefer using String, Number, BigInt, Boolean, and Symbol directly. âœ… ðŸ”§
prefer-negative-index Prefer negative index over .length - index when possible. âœ… ðŸ”§
prefer-node-protocol Prefer using the node: protocol when importing Node.js builtin modules. âœ… ðŸ”§
prefer-number-properties Prefer Number static properties over global ones. âœ… ðŸ”§ ðŸ’¡
prefer-object-from-entries Prefer using Object.fromEntries(â€¦) to transform a list of key-value pairs into an object. âœ… ðŸ”§
prefer-optional-catch-binding Prefer omitting the catch binding parameter. âœ… ðŸ”§
prefer-prototype-methods Prefer borrowing methods from the prototype instead of the instance. âœ… ðŸ”§
prefer-query-selector Prefer .querySelector() over .getElementById(), .querySelectorAll() over .getElementsByClassName() and .getElementsByTagName() and .getElementsByName(). âœ… ðŸ”§
prefer-reflect-apply Prefer Reflect.apply() over Function#apply(). âœ… ðŸ”§
prefer-regexp-test Prefer RegExp#test() over String#match() and RegExp#exec(). âœ… ðŸ”§ ðŸ’¡
prefer-set-has Prefer Set#has() over Array#includes() when checking for existence or non-existence. âœ… ðŸ”§ ðŸ’¡
prefer-set-size Prefer using Set#size instead of Array#length. âœ… ðŸ”§
prefer-spread Prefer the spread operator over Array.from(â€¦), Array#concat(â€¦), Array#{slice,toSpliced}() and String#split(''). âœ… ðŸ”§ ðŸ’¡
prefer-string-raw Prefer using the String.raw tag to avoid escaping \. âœ… ðŸ”§
prefer-string-replace-all Prefer String#replaceAll() over regex searches with the global flag. âœ… ðŸ”§
prefer-string-slice Prefer String#slice() over String#substr() and String#substring(). âœ… ðŸ”§
prefer-string-starts-ends-with Prefer String#startsWith() & String#endsWith() over RegExp#test(). âœ… ðŸ”§ ðŸ’¡
prefer-string-trim-start-end Prefer String#trimStart() / String#trimEnd() over String#trimLeft() / String#trimRight(). âœ… ðŸ”§
prefer-structured-clone Prefer using structuredClone to create a deep clone. âœ… ðŸ’¡
prefer-switch Prefer switch over multiple else-if. âœ… ðŸ”§
prefer-ternary Prefer ternary expressions over simple if-else statements. âœ… ðŸ”§
prefer-top-level-await Prefer top-level await over top-level promises and async function calls. âœ… ðŸ’¡
prefer-type-error Enforce throwing TypeError in type checking conditions. âœ… ðŸ”§
prevent-abbreviations Prevent abbreviations. âœ… ðŸ”§
relative-url-style Enforce consistent relative URL style. âœ… ðŸ”§ ðŸ’¡
require-array-join-separator Enforce using the separator argument with Array#join(). âœ… ðŸ”§
require-number-to-fixed-digits-argument Enforce using the digits argument with Number#toFixed(). âœ… ðŸ”§
require-post-message-target-origin Enforce using the targetOrigin argument with window.postMessage(). ðŸ’¡
string-content Enforce better string content. ðŸ”§ ðŸ’¡
switch-case-braces Enforce consistent brace style for case clauses. âœ… ðŸ”§
template-indent Fix whitespace-insensitive template indentation. âœ… ðŸ”§
text-encoding-identifier-case Enforce consistent case for text encoding identifiers. âœ… ðŸ”§ ðŸ’¡
throw-new-error Require new when creating an error. âœ… ðŸ”§

Deprecated Rules

See docs/deprecated-rules.md

Preset configs (eslint.config.js)

See the ESLint docs for more information about extending config files.

Note: Preset configs will also enable the correct language options.

Recommended config

This plugin exports a recommended config that enforces good practices.

ES Module (Recommended)

import eslintPluginUnicorn from 'eslint-plugin-unicorn';

export default [
		// â€¦
		eslintPluginUnicorn.configs['flat/recommended'],
		{
			rules: {
				'unicorn/better-regex': 'warn',
			},
		},
];

CommonJS

'use strict';
const eslintPluginUnicorn = require('eslint-plugin-unicorn');

module.exports = [
		// â€¦
		eslintPluginUnicorn.configs['flat/recommended'],
		{
			rules: {
				'unicorn/better-regex': 'warn',
			},
		},
];

All config

This plugin exports an all config that makes use of all rules (except for deprecated ones).

ES Module (Recommended)

import eslintPluginUnicorn from 'eslint-plugin-unicorn';

export default [
		// â€¦
		eslintPluginUnicorn.configs['flat/all'],
		{
			rules: {
				'unicorn/better-regex': 'warn',
			},
		},
];

CommonJS

'use strict';
const eslintPluginUnicorn = require('eslint-plugin-unicorn');

module.exports = [
		// â€¦
		eslintPluginUnicorn.configs['flat/all'],
		{
			rules: {
				'unicorn/better-regex': 'warn',
			},
		},
];

Preset configs (.eslintrc.* or package.json)

See the ESLint docs for more information about extending config files.

Note: Preset configs will also enable the correct parser options and environment.

Recommended config

This plugin exports a recommended config that enforces good practices.

{
	"name": "my-awesome-project",
	"eslintConfig": {
		"extends": "plugin:unicorn/recommended",
		"rules": {
			"unicorn/better-regex": "warn"
		}
	}
}

All config

This plugin exports an all config that makes use of all rules (except for deprecated ones).

{
	"name": "my-awesome-project",
	"eslintConfig": {
		"extends": "plugin:unicorn/all"
	}
}

Maintainers

  • Sindre Sorhus
  • Fisker Cheung
  • Bryan Mishkin
  • futpib

Former

  • Jeroen Engels
  • Sam Verschueren
  • Adam Babcock
